title: [Large-Scale] Cyber Range-Based Scientific Inquiry-Driven Security Talent Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of network/OS fundamentals, security concepts, and basic scientific inquiry methods (observation-hypothesis-experiment-conclusion), with experience in measuring and analyzing experimental data
context.additional_context: Mobile-optimized step-difficulty design and mentoring system application. Tracks individual cybersecurity competency changes through continuous data measurement/statistical analysis. Systematically maps the scientific inquiry process (observation→hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion) to cybersecurity scenarios.

learning_goals: Achieve 80% accuracy in APT attack response processes within 3 hours through CRX training based on real-world incident scenarios (emphasizing scientific analysis and digital evidence collection)
Achieve over 75% detection rate of OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities during simulated penetration testing (applying experimental approaches and controlled independent/dependent variables)

Learners apply the scientific methodology of hypothesis formulation → experimental design → data analysis → conclusion drawing in 4-member team-based cyber incident response scenarios. They divide roles, achieve ≥4 points (on a 5-point scale) in 4 out of 5 collaboration rubric criteria (communication, task distribution, problem-solving efficiency), and pass the final evaluation

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
